Reviews.Title: “thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: thomqui
Reviews.Content: I was looking for moderate priced hotel walking distance to convention center and this fit the bill. i found it to be clean, nice staff. my only complaint is about the thin tissues and toilet paper. i didn't arrive until late evening and there was no problem with that. But as others have said, there is a street people hospice next door so be aware. considering the hampton inn is just across the street for over twice the price, this is a steal. and the wireless worked well too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleM_LIU
Reviews.Content: Just run. Stay anywhere else--the Mariott on Market, Loews, the Bellevue, the Double Tree. It'll cost more, but it'll be worth your sanity. Two colleagues and I had to stay here forr three nights because it was what out employer would pay for. The staff was very nice, but even the most wonderful, accommodating people could not ameliorate the situation. People stay here because it's very cheap--you probably can't stay anywhere else in Philly for under $70. It is next door to a homeless men's shelter (and yes, they will say things to you and approach you), but it is across from a police station. We are from NY and are used to urban areas. However, we don't like to slum it, which is what we had to do at the Travelodge. Our rooms were tiny--no big deal, as we weren't going to be I our rooms often. But We didn't have any exterior windows. Our windows featured security glass, like the mind seen in prisons, and had lovely views of the hallway. You can hear everything through the paper thin walls--the beeping elevator buttons, the conversation in the next room, the sounds from the room above. My remote control's back panel was missing, so I had to use it upside down. My blanket had holes in it, and whenever I turned on the shower, the wall/pipes rattled loudly. The continental breakfast consisted of cold cereal, bagels, muffins, and hot beverages. Every day we stopped down for coffee, I noticed one yogurt (and only one yogurt) out for the taking. Odd. The low cost attracts normal, unsuspecting travelers but it attracts some class-less people, too. I was awoken at 4:04 am when I heard a guy pounding violently on his buddy's door, screaming that he was in dire need of a cheeseburger. It seems that many of the guests at the Travelodge enjoy standing in the hallway and yelling conversations to their friends at odd times of the day. On the last night I was there, I awoke with three bug bites I did not have when I went to sleep... I appreciate that this hotel fulfills a need for the budget traveler, but my advice is to avoid this place at all costs. Do you like getting more than five hours' sleep? Don't stay at the Travelodge. Do you like catcalls from the homeless? Don't stay at the Travelodge. Do you like getting a bargain, and then realizing that you've actually been duped into overpaying for the most horrible, uncomfortable stay you've ever had? Don't stay at the Travelodge!

Reviews.Title: “So so bad”
Reviews.Author: Flowerdiva71
Reviews.Content: Like a really bad dorm room from summer sports camp. Gross bedspreads, teensy rooms, commercial interior window with metal wire ( why does a window in an interior lobby need WIRE?)

Reviews.Title: “Great place tucked next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: WilmingtonMel
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a moderately priced hotel walking distance to the convention center. I found it here. It is a no frills place, but clean, safe, comfortable, and walking distance to the convention center. I was surprised how big the rooms were, as it really is tucked into a block on Race Ave. Keep in mind, there is no on site parking, but plenty close by. China town is a few blocks away, so it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “center city location, low price”
Reviews.Author: hlg60
Reviews.Content: If you plan to spend most of your time out of your room, this place is great. Walking distance to many sites, yet really inexpensive for a center city location. If you want amenities and extras, this is not the place for you, but if you just want a place to sleep and be relatively near a lot of the attractions for a affordable stay, I would recommend this Travelodge. The breakfast was basic oatmeal, cereal, bagels, which is all we eat for breakfast anyway, so it was fine. Might not have the cleanest bedspreads or carpets, but for the low price, it was definitely tolerable. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: purpleknitter
Reviews.Content: I never even stayed at this hotel. Full disclosure. At the time I booked this hotel online, there was a price break for prepaying and no refund for cancellation. OK I do have extenuating circumstances. I had hoped at least to speak to the owner to explain my situation and perhaps mitigate the charge as I am planning to come to Philly at a later date this year. The front desk staff was very helpful but the owner was the only one who could override the charge. I called several times (4) times over the course of a week. Left a message each time. No response. I will not be booking this hotel when I come back to Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Matt R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night recently and was pleasantly surprised. We were checked in by a polite and helpful member of staff and my room was excellent. It was clean, warm, well-furnished and in a great location near the centre of the city. We were able to walk to a decent restaurant for dinner but can't comment on breakfast as we had to leave too early. The only downside is the parking; we parked outside upon the advice of the receptionist, bought a ticket yet still got a parking violation fine! Apart from this I'd recommend this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: IAMCanadian85
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the worst setup in all of Philadelphia. Surrounded entirely by one-way streets, complete with no stopping signs everywhere (parking wars anyone?), this hotel is wedged between buildings on either side and does not have four walls to call its own. Situated in China Town the streets are bustling at all times of the day. I drove around the hotel's location three times before calling them...since I couldn't pull to the curb...and cancelling my reservation. I booked through expedia who put me on hold for twenty minutes at $2.00/minute roaming charge to complete the transaction. Thank god for the Mariott Courtyard which was a few blocks away and a whole different ball game. Travelodge does NOT have on site parking. They expected me to park two blocks away, walk through the streets with my luggage/ small children and not to worry. Crackheads are literally everywhere. The homeless are a serious problem in this area of town. I could go on and on...do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: Shirley C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my female friend on 15Nov for just a night. As there aren't many value hotels with free breakfast and free high speed Internet to choose from, we looked this hotel up through trip advisor. The homeless shelter next to the hotel made us worried before we got there, but things turned out better than we expected. First thing, location. This hotel is right next to the Philadelphia Convention Center and just a block from Reading Terminal Market. It was so easy to find! We just used the city map provided by the information desk at 30th street station and things worked out great. This hotel is also close to other landmarks like the Liberty Bell and Chinatown, all within walking distance. Right next to the hotel, there is a small convenience store that sells snacks and other amenities. This hotel is not far from the SEPTA station and it took us just 5 mins to get to 30th Street station. Really conveninent! Price and service come next. Staying at main hotel brands doesn't fit into our budget, this hotel provided a nice, comfortable place for us to spend the night in the city. Though the room was a little dark when all lights were on, we did not care much since we spent most of our time outside anyway. The bed was comfortable and the restroom and shower were clean. The signals of the wifi were really strong that my friend and I were able to upload photos to our blogs instantly. There are not many varieities for breakfast items though, they only had bagels, muffins, yogurt, and cereals. But the toaster made my bagels alright. One thing I have to pick about the free breakfast is, their coffee is tasteless. If you are a coffee lover, I recommend that you go pick up a starbucks instead. Check out was quick and the staff was friendly. My friend and I were not even paying attention to that homeless shelter at all, the people did not bother us and our trip ended up great.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge was fine”
Reviews.Author: MMMgo2011
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Philly one night for the marathon and the Travelodge was one of the most affordable and very convenient to where I needed to be all weekend (Convention Center and the Eakins Oval). I was a bit nervous about what I would find, but it was just fine. Better than I expected and the staff was very nice. Don't have high expectations for a luxurious stay, but as a place basically just to sleep that's affordable, I would say this is fine. Clean. Nothing fancy. One warning: I asked for a wake up call that never came. Have a back up.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny gem in the Center City!!”
Reviews.Author: use2bbandman
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago we were in Philadelphia to visit our son who lives in the Center City section of Philly. We selected the Travelodge, across the street from the Convention Center....and what a wonderful choice we made!!!! VERY clean, totally renovated and redecorated including new furnishings and bathrooms, wonderful caring staff who were so friendly and helpful, and....the most incredible location for downtown center city Philadelphia that we could have selected without having to pay a small fortune!!!! It is within walking distance to everything down town and also to the historic center to the east of the hotel. Even better, it was less than two blocks to the Reading Terminal Market....a MUST place to eat and visit when in Philadelphia!! We will MOST DEFINITELY stay there again the next time we are in Philadelphia!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Guillou_Guillou
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel especially if you need to be at the Conventin Center! The room was clean and confy. You will be satisfied here if you don't expect too much. I would recommend this place since the price is very good for the location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, good breakfast, clean room”
Reviews.Author: cookienani
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located next door to a men's homeless shelter but that did not bother us. it is 5 min walk to the L/subway station and about 20 mins to the old city where there are bars and restaurants. staff service was great, breakfast was included and consisted of bagel, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffe/tea, milk, cream cheese, jam. it is a $7-9 cab ride from the megabus bus terminal (30th street stn). and about a $10 cab ride to the greyhound stn. next door is a convenience store and chinatown. walking distance from the Love Park, and museums, liberty bell, hositorical sites etc. I went to the Mummy exhibition at Franklin centre. Paid $20 at a discount rate and was not worth it. don't bother going. Phili is a small city I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Served Its Purpose/Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: GigHarmon
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Travelodge in Philadelphia because they had the cheapest rate I could find near downtown. And while I still think it was expensive for what it was (but then again, I think better hotels are way overpriced at $200, 300, and 400 a night per room), it did serve as a good, central home base for my travels to Independence National Park, Old City, Center City and the Gayborhood. The biggest positive and pleasant surprise was the friendly service. My first room had a broken toilet and a room with windows facing the hallway and the front desk clerk happily and promptly moved me to another room â€“ this one with a window facing outside. The maids were all very friendly and courteous. And on the day of check-out, my flight wasnâ€™t until later, but they let me store my bags at the hotel while I explored more of the city. My bed was remarkably comfortable and the cleanliness of the room was adequate. However, the water in the shower was only luke-warm at best, although I didnâ€™t mention this to anyone. Only one real negative thing happened: I was awakened twice in the middle of the night by someone banging on the door two rooms down and by the loud verbal altercation -- shouting and threats between the parties involved included -- that pursued. Iâ€™m not sure what measures the hotel took, but it didnâ€™t happen a third time that night. I definitely donâ€™t need a lot of frills, so in this sense, the hotel totally served itâ€™s purpose for me â€“ a bed, shower, and a place to store my things while I visited Philadelphia. And if thatâ€™s all you need as well, then I definitely recommend saving a few bucks and staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hassle”
Reviews.Author: jmfinn
Reviews.Content: If you drive to this hotel you have to double park on a one way street (across from the convention center) and go register, lug your bags to your room then go back outside and drive two blocks to a parking garage (the hotel arranges for $10.00 parking) then walk back past several Asian restaurants and homeless people and perhaps a thunder and lighting storm for more fun. The free breakfast is cold cereal, whole milk, muffins, juice and coffee. Have a nice day. They do have free internet and free US Today papers. No restaurant for dinner and the nearest one is a block away. If you want anything other than one choice that is not Asian you will need a cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Legitimate.”
Reviews.Author: littlemascara3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute (15 minutes before checking in) and were able to get a very good rate of $71 (with a AAA discount) on Memorial Day weekend. The room was not huge, nor was the bathroom, but who really spends that much time in a hotel when on vacation anyway? We did not have any trouble with noises as we were far from the elevators/stairwells, however Monday must be trash day because the truck in the alleyway next to our room made a heck of a lot of noise for 5 am. But that of course is out of the control of the hotel. Friendly staff, continental breakfast in the a.m. It's true there is not on-site parking, but the front desk has coupons for the lot 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay! Great service, stay, & experience!”
Reviews.Author: SEtravelerguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The staff is of similar quality to a 5-star hotel. I was there for over a week and they were always very pleasant and helpful in making my experience so good. The hotel is very clean and they take great care of the property and the rooms. The bathroom was exceptionally clean and the shower had great pressure and never an issue with no hot water or anything. The free continental breakfast was a great way to start the day - cereal, yogurt, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, juice, and coffee. Also, there was free wireless internet that was very reliable and I never had a problem with it. Travelling on business, these free amenities were a great addition. The location is fabulous - it is literally next to the convention center (less than a 2 minute walk). The hotel is a block away from Reading Terminal market and the subway station. There are a lot of restaurants close by and only a few blocks away from the Art Museum and other Philly attractions. Other reviewers mentioned the homeless shelter; yes there is a shelter 2 doors down but there is not an issue at all. They don't disturb passer-byers and after 5pm when the shelter is closed, there is no one around outside so safety is no issue. This hotel is HIGHLY recommended and I would come back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: bdwtravel
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of sleepless nights thinking of this hotel with the bad reviews it has received. It was not as bad as it has been described, granted it is not a Sheraton, Hilton, Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton but for the price it was very good. I have stayed at all brands and this was a very good value. I was there with a colleague for a conference at the convention center right across the street. We spent 4 nights there and not one bed bug bite or other bad experience. The staff at the front desk was GREAT! Yes there is a homeless shelter next door but they did not bother you at all. The parking was about a 2 block walk into Chinatown and cost $15 a day with a coupon from the hotel. The continental breakfast was enough (muffins, bagels, cereal, coffee and tea). If you are going to the convention center and don't want to spend a lot of money this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls, made for an awful nights sleep and stay!”
Reviews.Author: sawyersgirl1852
Reviews.Content: Im gonna run through this terrible hotel step by step.First off we were told when booking that there was FREE parking in a lot right ext to the hotel, let the lies begin.. Parking was close to TWO blocks away & cost $25, and the employee working in the lot spoke next to NO english! When we finally got inside the hotel we were rudely treated by the front desk clerk. The computer took over 5 minutes to even pull up pur reservation, and when we asked for a late checkout the next day we were told something of the effect " I can only give out 2, I'm only allowed to give out 2"! My boyfriend and I were appauled by the way she spoke to us, and after some 'sucking up' she agreed to give us the hotels version of a 'late check-out' of 12pm. When we finally got to the room, it was small, dark and to say the least uninviting. There was no fridge, only 2 towels that were half the size of a normal bath towel. Later that night we learned that the shower didnt drain, so after a quick 5 minute shower, and some puddle splashing in the 6 inches of water at my feet I quickly dried off with the 'hand towel'. The woman in the room next to ours was coughing from 6pm to about 1am, and we were every minute of it. The walls were so thin we both thought at one point she was in our bathroom! Needless to say this hotel was subpar, the location was alright, but for next time we both agreed we would rather spend the extra money and stay in a reliable hotel, not some dump! Dont stay in the hotel, you will be very very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there. Noisy and bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Tedmetuchen
Reviews.Content: Bad experience. Could sleep all night because of bed bugs. Spots on towels and bed sheets. Noise of elevator all night if you are on ground floor level.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: dobbys_sock
Reviews.Content: When we booked Travelodge, we were only looking for a place to sleep for one night in Philadelphia. Naturally, we weren't expecting something luxurious, but let it be known that you get what you pay for here. I thought the hotel itself was in a nice location - there's a nice convenience store next door, and Jake's Pizza down the street is great. Some people complained of the hotels' proximity to a homeless shelter - I honestly had no problem with it at all. You wouldn't have even known it was there. The interior of the hotel was quite old/dirty, for example, there was mildew on the shower curtain, and the ventilator in the bathroom leaked. The room itself was incredibly tiny, with a window looking out only to the hallway. Our sink also was not located in the bathroom, which was a bit of an inconvenience. Just to sum it up... Pros: Price, Location, Staff Cons: Price, Cleanliness, Parking (2 blocks away, extra fee)

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!!”
Reviews.Author: pookiebear72008
Reviews.Content: This place looks nice when you first walk in, and the staff was nice at first. When we walked up to our room and entered, it was like entering a very small bedroom with two beds..The room was like 75-80 degrees when we walked in and the staff came up and "fixed" it, but said if it doesn't kick on he will bring us a fan! What??? I didn't pay this money to stay in a room that has no windows or air!!! this is rediculous!! Luckily we won't be in the room too much since we are here for buisness, but I highly do NOT recommend anyone stay here!!!! EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: southpaw2u
Reviews.Content: When I booked this reservation I thought of convenience and good rates. Well, let's just say it was short on convenience. There is no onsite parking. Visitors have to walk two blocks to a parking garage and bring a coupon with them each day to get a discount. The walk isn't bad if you are up to it, but the hotel is right next door to a homeless help center. Nothing wrong with that, but it is not most desirable for a first-time or for any visitor seeking safe lodging. Service is something we didn't get much of beyond a smile at check in time. Our room was one with a window with a view of a wall and construction site, loud construction. The carpet was damp and we were too tired too fuss. We were promised a new room the next day only to find another damp carpet, a TV that didn't work and a very weak shower head. So weak hardly any water dripped out of it. I booked this reservation through Priceline and when I wanted to receive some sort of retribution, discount, apology, something...anything to make us feel better, we were told that because it was not booked directly through the hotel I had to go through Priceline to make a complaint. Bottom line, this Travelodge location is not acceptable. It is what someone may call a "fleabag" hotel in my estimation. Maybe otherTravelodge locations are good, but I highly advise visitors to the PA Convention Center area to seek lodging elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gross unclean (folded) towel; multiple hairs on sheet; thin walls”
Reviews.Author: MRM10111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location -- 5 minutes to the Reading Market, across the street from the new Convention Center, and just a good central spot. Race Street at this section is a little sad, and the hotel is right next to a place that serves hungry people, nothing wrong with that! but a little depressing. Anyway, would have been okay but the room was as described in the headline there, one of the towels in the "clean" pile had a four-inch square rust-colored crust of blood? chocolate? UGH; and when I pulled back the bedspread to get in the sheets, they had multiple long and other hairs on them. The front desk guy first brought me 4 pillow cases; when I realized that, and returned, the front desk was empty for the next 15 minutes. Then he gave me a single sheet. I gave up, slept on that with a coat, was cold. The rooms have only a "window" to the interior hall/stairwell, with thin walls, it wasn't excessively loud since no one was next tome, but everytime anyone went to their room and talked, it was quite loud. The front desk day staff were great and helpful, but I absolutely cannot recommend it, it was only (with the AAA discount) 29 dollars less than the convention rate at the Hilton right next to the Reading Market, which was a VERY nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again”
Reviews.Author: miffina
Reviews.Content: luckliy we had booked only 1 night. First we were given a room with no window, actually there was one but on the internal corridor. The carpet was filthy, room noisy because of construction outside (not their fault), the AC broke in the middle of the night, the chair upholstery was VERY old, central location but near a homeless shelter. Noting positive about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Crit_Devil
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge right next to the Convention Center - which is under construction. It also lacked a few things you would hope they'd provide for a price that high. If you enjoy getting woken up to the melodious sounds of construction, don't need a small fridge, don't mind staying on a slightly dangerous block at night, enjoy gray walls with new good views of Philly, hard rock beds and over-washed rock pillows, and stoned/drunk boys yelling at 4am down the hallway - do stay here. Oh and bring your own conditioner, I only got a complimentary shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “I would not do it again”
Reviews.Author: MYBIZISURBIZ
Reviews.Content: We came to Philadelphia to help a family member. We decided it was best to stay in a hotel instead of at the family member's house because of various reasons. To start check in was pretty rocky. The hotel did not seem to be worth the price they were charging per night. I was told at check that there is no parking. You have to park in any nearby lot which range from 10 dollars to 30 dollars depending on what time you park and if you need to leave the lot and return. The neighborhood is not that great but I think if are looking to be near the Convention Center it is great. I did not need to be near the convention ctr. I did not know that there was a homeless shelter nearby because lots of homeless people were strolling near the hotel. The air conditioning in the room did not work so we had to be moved. Once moved the A/C in that room did not work efficently. After many calls to the front desk I was finally told how to set the A/C for maximum benefit. THe room did finally cool down but it took a while. The staff was pretty courteous and the hotel smelled really nice. I could have stayed in a hotel with more stars and had on site parking/versus this low budget high priced plus extra for parking hotel. ALso there is a lot of construction going on in this area right now.( cant hold that against the hotel). KIDS THERE IS NO POOL. But I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible location, next to a homeless shelter and my room had NO windows”
Reviews.Author: kellies1112
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel coming from boston to attend the burins flyers playoff game. i was not looking for anything too special or expensive because i was staying one night and didnt spend much time in the hotel anyways. when i got there i saw it was right next door to a homeless shelter i feel like i should have been notified about this. after i checked in, went up to my room and realized there were NO windows in my room. not happy at all about the price i paid and the service i got. i will never again stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's as if they went out of their way to make the rooms as loud as possible.”
Reviews.Author: smittylabeef
Reviews.Content: My room: ten feet from the front desk (on the same faux marble floor as the lobby), six inches from the stairwell, four feet from the elevator, three stairs up and four steps from the front door, and about seven feet above the sidewalk. In other words, as loud as a room could possibly be. When I went back to the front desk to get another I was shown the only other nonsmoking rooms they had, which were five feet across from the front desk, again on the same faux marble floor. From in there I can only imagine you could hear the desk clerk breathing. And, of course, every single footstep from every single person coming or going. In the end, I went with a smoking room on the third floor, two floors directly above the first room I was given. I was still stuck next to the road, the elevator, and the stairwell, but at least I wasn't right on the lobby. Not surprisingly, people coming and going still kept me awake all night long, despite ear plugs (and a pillow over my head). In the morning, trying to recover from that horrible night's sleep, I was treated to a shower of knocking pipes. Cold water worked fine. Hot not so much. There must be rooms in the place that aren't so totally uninhabitable, but I didn't see them. The four I was offered were each worse than any other hotel room I've ever seen. And I'm not accustomed to luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - shame about the lack of investment”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: We were running a bit over budget on our vacation so we dropped down market for our last night before flying home. Probably a bit more than we should have done. There are actually many positives to this hotel - friendly and helpful staff and a passion for cleanliness. The carpets were being shampooed when we arrive and the smell of bleach was clear in bathrooms and restrooms. While this is clearly a hotel that is lacking investment, to the point of shabbiness, the local team obviously take pride in their work and want to do their best with what they have got. So we come to the negatives. Other reviewers have commented on the location - the Convention Center is a massive barrier to feeling part of Center City and the hotel is at the end of a long tunnel through the Center that does not always feel very safe. It is next to a homeless shelter, although this seems to be well run and we certainly did not experience any hassle from the neighbours at any time. The rooms are small but manageable for the odd night - I wouldn't stay here for any longer. The bedding and towels were clean but threadbare. The towels did not absorb any moisture and the bedding - well I have seen thicker fabric on showgirls in Las Vegas. The complimentary breakfast had reasonable coffee but is otherwise best passed over - Reading Market is less than five minutes walk and a much better option! This hotel is in the wrong location ever to command a premium price, even in the budget sector, but the staff team do deserve better support from the owners in terms of investment.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel, great area, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hiker_n_biker
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I showed up to Philly this hotel was right off Broad street and two blocks from the subway, we thought it was very convenient considering we didn't have a car just our two feet. The hotel was a very good price, but you couldn't really tell until you took a shower. The shower had no pressure nor did it get very warm, so the shower was a little bit of a bummer but oh well you get what you pay for.... BUT after 2 days I mentioned it to the desk clerk he apologized and immediately sent someone to look at the shower, it was fixed within two hours! I was shocked and wished I had mentioned it sooner.. the hotel had a great location and was relatively inexpensive and definitely liveable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night during a trip to Philadelphia on holiday. Got the room for only Â£60 and it served its purpose perfectly. Room was spotless. Many cable channels on TV. Coffee maker in room. Basic breakfast (bagels, muffins, cereal, coffee/tea and juice only) included in the price. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. If you are there Sun - Thu night I would avoid rooms at the front of the hotel as there is a major piece of construction under way on the opposite side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and great value”
Reviews.Author: TDKPJ
Reviews.Content: It is great stay at the Travelodge. Its right across from the convention center. The Staff is friendly and helpful. although room is bit small but I am paying Alot less than other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Bitter Experience”
Reviews.Author: knv1954
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel since it was at a walkable distance from Pennsylvania Convention Centre( just opposite). The attitude of the front desk personnel was awful. The breakfast was stale-is it just because it was complimentary? No eggs were served and there was no variety. Of course no restaurant is there in the hotel and food will be served from Chase Lounge, a pub nearby ,if ordered. Though I was staying there for 4 nights, the front desk personnel would not give me 3 hours extra to check out on the last day saying that it was their policy. The hotel also not full at that time either. In the rooms towels will be changed only if asked and no room cleaning was undertaken. God knows why a 50 $ deposit is collected as precautionary measure and the signed bill was not returned when I checked out. Shall I say a permanent goodbye to the Hotel with unpleasant memories of the same?

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay Here if you need NOTHING more than a roof over your head”
Reviews.Author: lvlwing
Reviews.Content: Extremely rude and utterly unhelpful staff. No parking for hotel, nearest parking (and good luck getting decent directions to 24-hour parking) was $20 a day and did not feel safe at all leaving my car there. Small room with no wi-fi and internet LAN/ethernet hookup was not working. Decent area, adjacent to Chinatown. Would really only recommend if you only needed a roof over your head and a place to sleep for a few hours. Anything beyond that and you will be greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: morrisn
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel. That being said, It was clean, afordable, included a continental breakfast, and was very convenient to Reading Market, China Town, and the convention center. When I return to Philly, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for it's price”
Reviews.Author: sofke8868
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been to the Philadelphia Travelodge hotel twice. My stay last year was great: large & clean room with queen bed, perfect mattress, separate bathroom, good location, friendly staff. The only thing to improve was the â€œcontinentalâ€� breakfast â€“ I remember last year we could only choose between a muffin and a bagel. This year I was a little less fortunate. My room was just above the lobby and next to the elevator. Lots of noise, because the receptionist seemed to be making phone calls all of the time & there was noise when other guests took the elevator to their rooms. I complained about it the next morning and asked for another room. The receptionist didnâ€™t make any problem at all and by noon, I was checked into a room on the highest floor. In spite of that one noisy night, I definitely recommend this hotel. If youâ€™re a light sleeper (like me) just make sure to ask for a room on the highest floor. By the way, it's a hotel, not "motel".

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Experience”
Reviews.Author: chiacchio
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at this Philadelphia, PA Center City hotel for one night on a Saturday. When I arrived, I was expecting the hotel to be clean with professional staff. My first negative impression of the hotel came with my encounter with the desk clerk. He assigned me a room which I was not pleased with and said that only one other room was available, which I didn't believe because of the inactivity in the hotel lobby. Both the original room assigned to me and my request for a different room where unacceptable for the $139.00 room rate. The interior of the rooms were in below hotel standard conditions. The bathroom was similiar to a roominghouse bathroom. The bathroom or the room itself didn't seem sanitary for my conditions. The interior of the lobby of the hotel didn't impress me. The only staff I saw at the hotel during my first visit was the desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped spaces”
Reviews.Author: Rifleman_82
Reviews.Content: Room with two double beds; conditions were cramped. Bathroom was too small to fit a washbasin. That was in the room itself. Not enough space to open our luggage. Apart from that, nothing special. Hotel doesn't have any parking facilities; nearest one is just around the corner, 200 meters away. Parking is pricey though - $20 a day, Patriot Parking.

Reviews.Title: “No irons available!?”
Reviews.Author: Schnagel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine--except that the rooms don't come with iron and ironing board, and when I asked for one at the front desk, the clerk said they were all in use and I'd have to wait until someone returned one. Huh? Maybe....you should buy more irons if you run out of them! So I asked to file a complaint. Well, they're out of complaint forms too (why am I not surprised). So I asked where I could buy an iron; she didn't know but figured it was too late (6:15pm) to find a store that would have them anyways. So now I have to wake up early, go walk around to find an iron, come back, iron my clothes before my meetings for the day. The lack of a basic amenity and apathetic staff pretty much spoiled my impression of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Comfy”
Reviews.Author: benjaminprog
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for business trips, is near the main historic area and business area. The only minor flaw I found was that they didnâ€™t have wireless internet and the room was a bit small. But over all the room was very clean and very well put together.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, Noisy, Felt Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Frederick_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My son and I had to make an unexpected overnight trip to the Philadelphia area and booked the Travelodge Philadelphia the day before travel. We stayed at the hotel the night of 16 January 2007. We paid about $96.00, including taxes, for the night. The Travelodge is located in a convenient location for visiting the city center and is in easy walking distance to the Convention Center, Chinatown, and historic attractions. Unfortunately, the location is also on a dark (at night) street in an unsafe looking area, where I would not have walked outside at night if I had not been accompanied by my son. There were many homeless people hanging out two doors down. The hotel has no parking on site, but recommends that you park in a 24 hour attended garage about a block down the street on the right just as you enter Chinatown. The garage is clearly labeled Travelodge Parking and the parking (at the time of writing) is $15.00 a day. The front desk clerk was extremely helpful and friendly. Unfortunately, we got a first floor room (#108), across from the check -in desk. I should have insisted on changing rooms right then, as I knew that a room next to the desk (and there are several of these) was going to be extremely noisy, and I was right. Not only was there noise off and on all night, at 3 am there was a great deal of commotion which resulted in the police being called, who ran around the hotel shouting for over 20 minutes (I never did find out what happened). They then spent several more minutes loudly gossiping with the front desk clerk until I called to complain about the noise and they left. Our room was TINY, the smallest I've ever stayed in, and that includes hotel rooms in New York City and Europe. There was just room for 2 double beds and there was no closet area. Instead, there was a coat rack which partially hung over one of the beds. The one window gave a view of the hall, so the curtains had to be kept shut all the time, unless you wanted everyone entering the hotel to look right into the room. It was rather like being in a tomb. On the plus side, the room was clean. Due to the very small rooms, noise level, and unsafe feeling location, I cannot recommend this hotel. I would especially caution single women travelers to stay clear, as it just didn't feel safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with less price”
Reviews.Author: chomporn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheaper place to stay (just to sleep) near Pennsylvania Convention Center, in case you have a conference or meeting there, this is a very good one. The hotel is just crossing the street to the convention center by which you can walk comfortably. Pros: location, free in-room internet access (+++), nice staff. Cons: small room, quite scary dark road when walking alone on the right side and opposite to the hotel. When consider for the price (around $100/night) and it's location, this is a good option for those who will have business at the Penn Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: HKGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge over Labor Day weekend. Yes the hotel is on a side street and it's possible you can get a room without a window. But the hotel is located in a good area. Both Reading Market and Chinatown is a block away. You're also not too far away from Phlash Shuttle. However do be careful at night as there are homeless people waiting for a free bed at the shelter 2 doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Great for vampires!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 3 nights at this hotel because of its location in downtown Philadelphia. I checked out after one night because my room had no window and it felt like I was living in a closet! The lack of any natural light was completely depressing, and because the hotel was booked up for a convention, I couldn't switch rooms to one with a window. Otherwise, the room was clean, but small and cramped. The breakfast buffet consisted of a sad array of cold cereals and mini-bagels. The room was definitely not worth the $140/night. From the layout of the hotel, it appears that most room are windowless (a few with windows look out over Race street or the back alley). If you intend to stay here, make sure to ask for a room with a window, unless you are using the hotel solely as a convention-center crash pad--or unless you are a vampire!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Philly”
Reviews.Author: lastiki
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Travelodge in Philadelphia. Great value hotel based on the price. Nice room. Clean and new with a nice working shower. Perfect for 2 people. Asked for extra pillows on our second night and they were there for the rest of our stay. Front desk was friendly and helpful. We were even able to check in 3 hours early on our arrival day - a big plus! Breakfast was just enough to get you off and started on your day (milk, juice, coffee, bagels, danish, fruit, and some days cereal). The Travelodge was in walking distance to the historic area and near public transportation (main reason we picked this hotel). Serveral days, we'd go out and then stop back for a break before heading out again. There was also a restaurant Penn View Inn right on the corner serving good and inexpensive dishes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We enjoyed our stay and if returning to Philly would pick the Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room with great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk agent is very polite and professional. It is very convience going to the convention center, and the room we book from travelodge.com and got a great rate. The cleaniness of the room is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Good price, Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the convention center. We had stays there for 5 nights we save alot of money stay there. Although, there was not much amentites. But the room was very neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Okay and close to PA Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: NW_Family_of_5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early May. The hotel is across the street from the convention center, but you have to walk 2 blocks to the entrance. I would not suggest doing the walk alone at night! Our room was on the 4th floor and had an outside window. The room was small and clean. The one problem was 2 out of 3 days we had really low water pressure - the water stopped running one morning in the middle of my shower. On Friday and Saturday night our neighbors, a group of college men, were extremely loud. Yelling, wrestling for hours! The hotel did nothing!!! The staff was helpful when asked, but did not go out of their way to be friendly. For the price $80 and location, the hotel was okay, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Writer312
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical going into the Travelodge Philadelphia after reading some information on its location, but once arriving there, I was very pleased. I NEVER felt unsafe and in all reality the location is extremely convenient-two blocks from the Convention Center, Terminal Market, and the taxi stand (very important if you don't have a car.) The staff was courteous and helpful at both check in and checkout. They even suggested two great restaurants. The rooms were tiny and if you like natural light, this hotel is not for you. Almost all the rooms don't have a window looking outside because it's between two buildings. But the beds were comfortable, the rooms clean, and there was always instant hot water. Overall, I was very impressed (especially for the price I paid-$98). A great place for the travel savvy tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $79 per night. We were very pleased with the cleanliness and the updated appearance of the room. The continental breakfast consisted of apples, oranges, danishes, muffins, toast, and raisin bran. Nothing stale. Enough for our family. Very quiet hotel. We stayed in room #430. I was skeptical of Travelodge but we had a pleasant experience. Parking is $14 per day and you must request in and out privileges at initial drop-off.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to check out”
Reviews.Author: hackett2069
Reviews.Content: I wonder if the reviewers stayed at the same place we did this past weekend. We booked at last minute so this was all that was available that did not cost over $200.00. so we weren't expecting a luxury hotel. But for $107 per night, we expected to have a clean room with a hot shower. The room was not exactly filthy but not exactly clean. The shower took a long time to heat up and had very little pressure. The sink was out in the sleeping area, which was also very small. There were red stains on the carpet which I hope was paint not blood. There was a burn hole in the bedspread. We had planned to stay 2 nights but decided during dinner that we weren't staying the second night. Fortunately we only live an hour away. This would be OK if the price was $50-$60 but not $107, its basically just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Quite new, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looking for a good place to stay right in the center of Philadelphia as I was for two nights? Yes, this could be it. No need for a car here. If you arrive by plane, just take the RR1 to Market East Station and the Travelodge is about a 7-minute walk away. Then, walking will take you to all the places that are of interest within the city. This property is quite new. And that also means that there is an area nearby that is not so new and you will feel a little bit unsafe, especially when itÂ´s dark outside. But the Travelodge itself and all its rooms are new and therefore in an excellent condition. However, you get a clean room and thatÂ´s about it. The bathroom and the hairdryer are in good shape, too, but the sink will be in your room and not in the bathroom. As mentioned in other reviews, the windows will not allow an interesting look outside. From my room, I was opposite an office building that I could nearly reach by stretching out my arm. And what about your privacy when you get a room with a window facing the interior corridor? You can expect all the usual amenities here. The breakfast is just the basic stuff really. Only coffee, orange juice and a danish, sometimes bread, are provided. Had one problem when my room key did not work on day two, but that was solved promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonDiff
Reviews.Content: A great location adjacent to PA Convention Center makes this hotel a great value for the money. Clean rooms, free high speed internet, free continental breakfast, and no problems of any kind. Parking lots within 1/2 block. Note most rooms do not have exterior windows but do have a window facing the interior atrium which does allow in some natural light. We were lucky and got a room with an exterior window.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: MadeinNZ1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly new and therefore modern and well kept. Rooms are spotless with all the amenities. Great shower, lots of hot water. Only downside is that, as a terrace building, most rooms have no exterior window. Interior atrium and large skylight makes things lighter. Directly across from Convention Centre - 5 mins walk from Reading Terminal Market and China town. Definitely recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Philadelphia Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 1227 Race St., Philadelphia, PA 19107
